v.v: Rally yourselves together and gather, unashamed nation—
before the decree takes effect and that day passes like the chaff,
Seek Yahweh, all you humble people on earth who obey his decrees!
For Gaza will be abandoned, and Ashkelon will turn into a devastation.
Woe to the inhabitants of the seacoast, the nation of the Kerethites! Yahweh has spoken against you,
So the seacoast will become pastures for shepherds and for sheep pens.
The coastal region will belong to the remnant of the house of Judah,
“I have heard the taunts of Moab and the reviling of the people of Ammon
Therefore, as I live—this is the declaration of Yahweh of hosts, God of Israel—

v: before the fierce anger of Yahweh’s wrath comes upon you, before the day of the wrath of Yahweh comes upon you.
and perhaps you will be protected in the day of Yahweh’s wrath.
They will drive out Ashdod at noon, and they will uproot Ekron!
Canaan, land of the Philistines. I will destroy you until no inhabitant remains.
who will shepherd their flocks there. Their people will lie down in the evening in the houses of Ashkelon,
for Yahweh their God will care for them and restore their fortunes.
when they taunted my people and violated their borders.
Moab will become like Sodom, and the people of Ammon like Gomorrah;
a place of nettles and a salt pit, deserted forever.
But the remnant of my people will plunder them, and the remainder of my nation will take possession of them.”

v.v: This will happen to Moab and Ammon because of their pride, since they taunted and mocked the people of Yahweh of hosts.
Then they will fear Yahweh, for he will taunt all the gods of the earth. Everyone will worship him, everyone from his own place, from every seashore.
You Cushites also will be pierced by my sword,
and God’s hand will attack the north and destroy Assyria,
Then herds will lie down there, every animal of the nations,
This is the exultant city that lived without fear,

v: so that Nineveh will become an abandoned devastation, as dry as the desert.
both the desert owl and the screech owl will rest in the top of her columns.
A call will sing out from the windows; rubble will be in the doorways; her carved cedar beams will be exposed.
that said in her heart, “I am, and nothing is my equal.”
How she has become a horror, a place for beasts to lie down in.
Everyone that passes by her will hiss and shake his fist at her.
